intro: Curculigo scapigera, commonly known as the slender arrowhead, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Pacific. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, commonly known as the orchid family, and is characterized by its unique, arrow-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences, which are typically borne on long, slender stems. Curculigo scapigera is adapted to grow in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest undergrowth or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and relatively rare species within the orchid family.
